column4: UPDATE 1-Seat charges help Ryanair profit meet forecast
column5: DUBLIN  July 29 Cutbacks by rivals and extra charges for choosing seats helped low-cost airline Ryanair meet forecasts with profit of 78 million euros ($103 million) in the three months to June  the Irish airline said on Monday.

column5: DUBLIN  July 29 Retrenching rivals and extra charges for choosing seats helped low-cost airline Ryanair meet forecasts with profit of 78 million euros ($103 million) in the three months to June  the Irish airline said on Monday.

column5: Sinclair Broadcast Group Inc said it will acquire eight television stations from the Allbritton family for $985 million  the latest deal in a flurry of activity to buy local broadcasters.

column5: July 29 Sinclair Broadcast Group Inc  said it will buy eight television stations from companies owned by the Allbritton family for about $985 million.

column4: Frugal U.S. families focus on cheaper colleges: Sallie Mae
column5: BOSTON While higher education remains a priority  many Americans are balking at high-priced institutions  and two-thirds of families eliminated colleges or universities during the 2012-2013 application process based on affordability  according to student lender Sallie Mae.

column4: Vertex loss narrows as cystic fibrosis drug sales grow

column4: Vertex loss narrows as demand for cystic fibrosis drug strong
column5: July 29 Vertex Pharmaceuticals Inc  which last week had an experimental oral hepatitis drug placed on partial clinical hold by U.S. health regulators  posted a narrower quarterly loss on stronger-than-expected demand for its cystic fibrosis treatment.

column4: UPDATE 4-America Movil ends KPN pact  may eye buy-out

column5: MEXICO CITY  July 29 Mexico's IPC stock index dropped 1 percent on Monday  dragged down by mogul Carlos Slim's telecoms giant America Movil and cautious trading ahead of key U.S. economic data due this week.

column4: KPN says America Movil cancels agreements  can up stake in KPN

column5: July 29 British aero engineer Senior Plc  reported a 6 percent rise in adjusted first-half profit  driven by demand for commercial aircraft parts from Airbus and Boeing Co.

column4: Brazil BRF reports Q2 profit of 208.4 mln reais  misses forecast

column4: CBS  Time Warner Cable extend deadline for new agreement
column5: July 29 Time Warner Cable Inc and CBS broadcast network  which are locked in a battle over fees the cable company pays to carry CBS programming  said they would negotiate until 8 p.m. on Monday  at least temporarily averting a blackout in some large cities.
